snippet: The protester, Ilya Guschin, grabbed a police officer by his uniform and tried to throw him to the ground and could  be sentenced to up to 13 years in prison.
abstract: Moscow district court arrests Ilya Guschin, participant in May 2012 protest against Vladimir V Putin, on charge of rioting and attacking police; Guschin, one of 20 people facing similar charges, could face up to 13 years in prison if convicted.
lead_paragraph: The protester, Ilya Guschin, grabbed a police officer by his uniform and tried to throw him to the ground and could  be sentenced to up to 13 years in prison.

headline.main: In Russia, Protester in May Rally Arrested
headline.print_headline: Russia: Protester in May Rally Arrested
